title: French prosecutor seeks homicide charges in far-right activist killing
subhead: Lyon prosecutor Thierry Dran sought homicide charges against seven suspects in the fatal beating of far-right activist Quentin Deranque. Most of the 11 suspects who had been detained are from far-left movements.

title: From the Château de Versailles to the Elysée, the unshakable Catherine Pégard
UK police arrest Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor
Epstein files hand French prosecutors trove of new leads
subhead: The Paris prosecutor's office opened two investigations on Wednesday: one into 'human trafficking' and the other regarding 'financial offenses such as money laundering, breaches of probity, or tax fraud.'

title: Gaza's local authorities massively underreported deaths, says international research team
subhead: The first independent field study on Gaza to not involve local authorities, published in The Lancet Global Health on Wednesday, concludes that the number of violent deaths linked to the conflict has been underreported by about 35%.

title: Leila Shahid, a powerful voice for Palestine, dies
subhead: A woman of conviction and dialogue, passionate about her cause yet sensitive to all forms of injustice, the former representative of Palestine in France and to the European Union, who ended her life on Wednesday, February 18, at the age of 76, was far more than a diplomat.

title: Tom Fletcher: 'Anyone who says the UN is dead should spend some time with my colleagues in Sudan or DRC'
subhead: The United Nations under-secretary-general for humanitarian affairs defends the role of United Nations agencies in global crises and calls for unhindered access to the Gaza Strip.

title: Trump's Board of Peace opens with $10 billion pledge and troops for Gaza
Xavier Dolan, filmmaker: "Where does the idea that artists should 'stay out of politics' come from?"
Airbus aims for record aircraft deliveries in 2026
Louvre robbery reveals 'systemic failures,' inquiry finds
The foretold crash of the French-German fighter jet
France to arm railway and metro police with stun guns
In India, Macron calls on French 'extremist parties' to 'clean house' over death of far-right activist
Nestlé exits ice cream market and partially withdraws from bottled water
Christine Lagarde may leave European Central Bank before end of term
US trade deficit in goods widens to new record in 2025
France's image deteriorates in the eyes of American investors
South Korean ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol sentenced to life in prison for insurrection
Anthropic, the AI start-up that dares to defy Donald Trump
subhead: Dario Amodei, the CEO of the artificial intelligence company, acknowledged disagreements with the White House over the regulation and military use of his technology. This is a rare stance in the US, where the tech industry has generally pledged allegiance to the president.

title: Kyiv's fourth winter at war has spared no one
subhead: In the freezing Ukrainian capital, residents are regularly without heat and electricity. People get by through resourcefulness and solidarity, living with a sense of inevitability.

title: Epstein scandal divides the MAGA world and weakens Trump
subhead: Since the latest release of files on the sexual predator, supporters of the US president have questioned the administration's lack of transparency and confusing communication.

title: 'The spectacle of European disunity in the face of pressure from both the United States and China is infuriating'
'Today, 96% of the world's nuclear weapons are held by states with authoritarian leaders'
'The fall of the cumbersome Jack Lang is seen as providential for France's political spectrum, which remains paralyzed by his cultural legacy'
